alert.note: Alert for Riverside (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 01 at 8:29PM PDT until September 01 at 9:30PM PDT by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM PDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 1045 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 828 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain has fallen due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing in the warned area. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Blythe, Midland, Nicholls Warm Springs, Blythe Airport, Ripley, Palo Verde and East Blythe. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
